intro: Henriettella caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its distinctive elongated flower clusters and small, leathery leaves make it an attractive addition to woodland gardens. Henriettella caudata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
